CatDescriptText: Mrs. Robert G. Lageman, Crafton and Mrs. John Maley, Northside, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 23, 1960, pg. 32 with question: "Do you favor pari-mutuel harness racing in Pennsylvania?" Mrs. Lageman's answer reads: "I'm for it.  Why go to West Virginia or Ohio?  Why not have it here in the state?"  Mrs. Maley's answer reads: "We need something like it in Pennsylvania.  There are a lot of people who like horse-racing but have to drive out of state to enjoy it."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Group portrait of three women standing, including Mrs. Robert G. Lageman in center wearing floral headpiece with netting and dark jacket with brooch posed in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Mrs. John Maley wearing swirly patterned short sleeve dress, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
